Authors:
Huzefa A Raja, Jacques Fournier, Carol A. Shearer, Andrew
N. Miller
Title:
Freshwater Ascomycetes: Coniochaeta gigantospora sp. nov.
based on morphological and molecular data
Abstract:
Coniochaeta gigantospora collected from submerged wood in
a freshwater habitat in France is described and illustrated as a new
species in the family Coniochaetaceae (Coniochaetales, Ascomycota). This
placement is based on morphology and phylogenetic analyses of partial
nuclear ribosomal 28S large subunit (LSU) and complete internal
transcribed spacer (ITS) DNA sequence data. Coniochaeta gigantospora is
distinguished from other Coniochaeta species in possessing unusually
large, ellipsoid, nearly equilateral, olivaceous to olivaceous brown
ascospores.
